dmca.title: Owner of SecurityFocus Claims Abandoned Website Infringes
dmca.body:
The copyrighted work at issue is the text which appears on 
http://msgs.securitypoint.com/cgi-bin/get/bugtraq0111/140.html.


HISTORY: [private], owner of the SecurityFocus "BugTraq" newsgroup removed the original 
copy of this post from the "BugTraq" mailing list and acknowledged that I had complete 
control of the content of this post back on March 25, 2002. The linked page noted above is 
unauthorized archive of [private]'s newsgroup and an unauthorized reprint of work which 
[private] acknowledges belongs to me. In accordance with [private]'s wishes and my wishes, 
almost all her BugTraq archives have removed their copies of my post. It is likely this 
site retains their copy because the company hosting the content has gone out of business 
(repeated attempts to contact the company via email and phone have all failed).

2. The complete text of this page infringes. This page can be found in Google searches as... 
       Search query: [private] site:securepoint.com
       Infringing webpages: http://msgs.securepoint.com/cgi-bin/get/bugtraq0111/140.html

3. [private], [private], Madison, WI 53705; [private];
[private]@standardnetworks.com

4. [private]@2securepoint.com:[private]voice; http://www.securepoint.com/?contact 
(NOTE: I have attempted to contact this company several times via email with no response 
and via the phone with no answer. It is currently my belief that "SecurePoint" went out of 
business several months ago but left its website on the Internet without a live 
administrator.)

5. 1 have in good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on
the allegedly infringing webpages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, 
or the law.

6. I swear, under penalty of perjury consistent with United States Code Title 17, Section 512
,that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or 
am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly 
infringed.


8. Faxed to Google Inc. [private] Attn: User Support, DMCA Complaints


8/25/04
[private]
Standard Network
